Introduction to Python Programming.Description: Write a simple program to print 'Hello, World!' to the console.
Introduction to Python Programming.Instruction: Use the 'print' statement to display the text 'Hello, World!'

Introduction to Python Programming.Title: Calculator Program
Introduction to Python Programming.Description: Create a basic calculator program that performs addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.
Introduction to Python Programming.Instruction: Take user input for two numbers and perform the selected arithmetic operation.
Introduction to Python Programming.Solution:
# Solution code
# Calculator program

# Function to perform addition

def add(num1, num2):
    return num1 + num2

# Function to perform subtraction

def subtract(num1, num2):
    return num1 - num2

# Function to perform multiplication

def multiply(num1, num2):
    return num1 * num2

# Function to perform division

def divide(num1, num2):
    return num1 / num2

# Get user input
num1 = float(input('Enter first number: '))
num2 = float(input('Enter second number: '))

# Display menu
print('Select operation:')
print('1. Add')
print('2. Subtract')
print('3. Multiply')
print('4. Divide')

# Get user choice
choice = input('Enter choice (1/2/3/4): ')

# Perform operation based on user choice
if choice == '1':
    print(num1, '+', num2, '=', add(num1, num2))
elif choice == '2':
    print(num1, '-', num2, '=', subtract(num1, num2))
elif choice == '3':
    print(num1, '*', num2, '=', multiply(num1, num2))
elif choice == '4':
    print(num1, '/', num2, '=', divide(num1, num2))
else:
    print('Invalid choice')

Introduction to Python Programming.Title: File Handling
Introduction to Python Programming.Description: Learn to read from and write to files in Python.
Introduction to Python Programming.Instruction: Create a program that reads data from a text file, performs some operation, and writes the result to another file.
Introduction to Python Programming.Solution:
# Solution code
# File handling

# Open the input file
inputFile = open('input.txt', 'r')

# Open the output file
outputFile = open('output.txt', 'w')

# Read the input file line by line
for line in inputFile:
    # Perform some operation on the line
    result = line.upper()
    # Write the result to the output file
    outputFile.write(result)

# Close the input file
inputFile.close()

# Close the output file
outputFile.close()

Introduction to Python Programming.Title: Web Scraping
Introduction to Python Programming.Description: Explore web scraping using Python libraries.
Introduction to Python Programming.Instruction: Write a program to extract information from a website (e.g., news headlines) using web scraping techniques.
Introduction to Python Programming.Solution:
# Solution code
# Web scraping

# Import the required libraries
import requests
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup

# Get the HTML content of the website
url = 'https://www.nytimes.com/'
response = requests.get(url)

# Parse the HTML content
soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser')

# Get the headlines
headlines = soup.find_all('h2', class_='css-1qwxefa esl82me0')

# Display the headlines
for headline in headlines:
    print(headline.text)

Introduction to Python Programming.Title: Object-Oriented Programming (OOP)
Introduction to Python Programming.Description: Introduction to object-oriented concepts in Python.
Introduction to Python Programming.Instruction: Create a program that defines classes and demonstrates inheritance, encapsulation, and polymorphism.
Introduction to Python Programming.Solution:
# Solution code
# Object-oriented programming

# Define a class named 'Person'
class Person:
    # Define a constructor to initialize the attributes
    def __init__(self, name, age):
        self.name = name
        self.age = age

    # Define a method to display the details
    def displayDetails(self):
        print('Name:', self.name)
        print('Age:', self.age)

# Define a class named 'Employee' that inherits from the 'Person' class
class Employee(Person):
    # Define a constructor to initialize the attributes
    def __init__(self, name, age, salary):
        # Call the constructor of the parent class
        super().__init__(name, age)
        self.salary = salary

    # Define a method to display the details
    def displayDetails(self):
        # Call the method of the parent class
        super().displayDetails()
        print('Salary:', self.salary)

# Create an object of the 'Employee' class
emp = Employee('John', 30, 50000)

# Display the details of the employee
emp.displayDetails()

Excel Macros and VBA.Title: Record a Macro
Excel Macros and VBA.Description: Use the macro recorder to automate a simple task in Excel.
Excel Macros and VBA.Instruction: Record a macro that formats a range of cells with a specific color, font, and border.
Excel Macros and VBA.Code:
' The following code was generated by the macro recorder
Sub FormatCells()
' FormatCells Macro
' Format a range of cells with a specific color, font, and border

' Select the range of cells
Range("A1:C5").Select
' Change the fill color to yellow
With Selection.Interior
    .Pattern = xlSolid
    .PatternColorIndex = xlAutomatic
    .Color = 65535
    .TintAndShade = 0
    .PatternTintAndShade = 0
End With
' Change the font to Arial, size 12, bold
With Selection.Font
    .Name = "Arial"
    .FontStyle = "Bold"
    .Size = 12
    .Strikethrough = False
    .Superscript = False
    .Subscript = False
    .OutlineFont = False
    .Shadow = False
    .Underline = xlUnderlineStyleNone
    .ThemeColor = xlThemeColorLight1
    .TintAndShade = 0
    .ThemeFont = xlThemeFontNone
End With
' Add a thin black border around the cells
Selection.Borders(xlDiagonalDown).LineStyle = xlNone
Selection.Borders(xlDiagonalUp).LineStyle = xlNone
With Selection.Borders(xlEdgeLeft)
    .LineStyle = xlContinuous
    .ColorIndex = 0
    .TintAndShade = 0
    .Weight = xlThin
End With
With Selection.Borders(xlEdgeTop)
    .LineStyle = xlContinuous
    .ColorIndex = 0
    .TintAndShade = 0
    .Weight = xlThin
End With
With Selection.Borders(xlEdgeBottom)
    .LineStyle = xlContinuous
    .ColorIndex = 0
    .TintAndShade = 0
    .Weight = xlThin
End With
With Selection.Borders(xlEdgeRight)
    .LineStyle = xlContinuous
    .ColorIndex = 0
    .TintAndShade = 0
    .Weight = xlThin
End With
With Selection.Borders(xlInsideVertical)
    .LineStyle = xlContinuous
    .ColorIndex = 0
    .TintAndShade = 0
    .Weight = xlThin
End With
With Selection.Borders(xlInsideHorizontal)
    .LineStyle = xlContinuous
    .ColorIndex = 0
    .TintAndShade = 0
    .Weight = xlThin
End With
End Sub
Excel Macros and VBA.Solution:
' Solution code
' The following code was generated by the macro recorder
Sub FormatCells()
' FormatCells Macro
' Format a range of cells with a specific color, font, and border

' Select the range of cells
Range("A1:C5").Select
' Change the fill color to yellow
With Selection.Interior
    .Pattern = xlSolid
    .PatternColorIndex = xlAutomatic
    .Color = 65535
    .TintAndShade = 0
    .PatternTintAndShade = 0
End With
' Change the font to Arial, size 12, bold
With Selection.Font
    .Name = "Arial"
    .FontStyle = "Bold"
    .Size = 12
    .Strikethrough = False
    .Superscript = False
    .Subscript = False
    .OutlineFont = False
    .Shadow = False
    .Underline = xlUnderlineStyleNone
    .ThemeColor = xlThemeColorLight1
    .TintAndShade = 0
    .ThemeFont = xlThemeFontNone
End With
' Add a thin black border around the cells
Selection.Borders(xlDiagonalDown).LineStyle = xlNone
Selection.Borders(xlDiagonalUp).LineStyle = xlNone
With Selection.Borders(xlEdgeLeft)
    .LineStyle = xlContinuous
    .ColorIndex = 0
    .TintAndShade = 0
    .Weight = xlThin
End With
With Selection.Borders(xlEdgeTop)
    .LineStyle = xlContinuous
    .ColorIndex = 0
    .TintAndShade = 0
    .Weight = xlThin
End With
With Selection.Borders(xlEdgeBottom)
    .LineStyle = xlContinuous
    .ColorIndex = 0
    .TintAndShade = 0
    .Weight = xlThin
End With
With Selection.Borders(xlEdgeRight)
    .LineStyle = xlContinuous
    .ColorIndex = 0
    .TintAndShade = 0
    .Weight = xlThin
End With
With Selection.Borders(xlInsideVertical)
    .LineStyle = xlContinuous
    .ColorIndex = 0
    .TintAndShade = 0
    .Weight = xlThin
End With
With Selection.Borders(xlInsideHorizontal)
    .LineStyle = xlContinuous
    .ColorIndex = 0
    .TintAndShade = 0
    .Weight = xlThin
End With
End Sub

Excel Macros and VBA.Title: Create a User-Defined Function
Excel Macros and VBA.Description: Write a custom function in VBA that performs a specific calculation or operation.
Excel Macros and VBA.Instruction: Create a function named 'SumOfSquares' that takes two numbers as arguments and returns the sum of their squares.
Excel Macros and VBA.Code:
' Define a function named SumOfSquares
Function SumOfSquares(num1 As Double, num2 As Double) As Double
' Calculate the sum of the squares of the two numbers
SumOfSquares = num1 ^ 2 + num2 ^ 2
End Function
Excel Macros and VBA.Solution:
' Solution code
' Define a function named SumOfSquares
Function SumOfSquares(num1 As Double, num2 As Double) As Double
' Calculate the sum of the squares of the two numbers
SumOfSquares = num1 ^ 2 + num2 ^ 2
End Function

Excel Macros and VBA.Title: Use a Loop
Excel Macros and VBA.Description: Use a loop to repeat a block of code a certain number of times or until a condition is met.
Excel Macros and VBA.Instruction: Write a program that loops through the cells in column A and displays their values in a message box.
Excel Macros and VBA.Code:
' Declare a variable to store the row number
Dim row As Long
' Initialize the row number to 1
row = 1
' Loop through the cells in column A until an empty cell is encountered
Do While Cells(row, 1).Value <> ""
' Display the value of the cell in a message box
MsgBox Cells(row, 1).Value
' Increment the row number by 1
row = row + 1
' End the loop
Loop
Excel Macros and VBA.Solution:
' Solution code
' Declare a variable to store the row number
Dim row As Long
' Initialize the row number to 1
row = 1
' Loop through the cells in column A until an empty cell is encountered
Do While Cells(row, 1).Value <> ""
' Display the value of the cell in a message box
MsgBox Cells(row, 1).Value
' Increment the row number by 1
row = row + 1
' End the loop
Loop

Excel Macros and VBA.Title: Use an Array
Excel Macros and VBA.Description: Use an array to store and manipulate multiple values of the same data type.
Excel Macros and VBA.Instruction: Write a program that creates an array of 10 random numbers between 1 and 100, sorts them in ascending order, and displays them in a message box.
Excel Macros and VBA.Code:
' Declare an array of 10 elements
Dim arr(1 To 10) As Integer
' Declare a variable to store the index
Dim i As Integer
' Loop through the array and assign random numbers between 1 and 100
For i = 1 To 10
arr(i) = Int(Rnd * 100) + 1
Next i
' Sort the array in ascending order using the bubble sort algorithm
Dim j As Integer
Dim temp As Integer
For i = 1 To 9
For j = i + 1 To 10
If arr(i) > arr(j) Then
' Swap the elements
temp = arr(i)
arr(i) = arr(j)
arr(j) = temp
End If
Next j
Next i
' Declare a variable to store the output string
Dim output As String
output = ""
' Loop through the array and concatenate the elements to the output string
For i = 1 To 10
output = output & arr(i) & " "
Next i
' Display the output string in a message box
MsgBox output
Excel Macros and VBA.Solution:
' Solution code
' Declare an array of 10 elements
Dim arr(1 To 10) As Integer
' Declare a variable to store the index
Dim i As Integer
' Loop through the array and assign random numbers between 1 and 100
For i = 1 To 10
arr(i) = Int(Rnd * 100) + 1
Next i
' Sort the array in ascending order using the bubble sort algorithm
Dim j As Integer
Dim temp As Integer
For i = 1 To 9
For j = i + 1 To 10
If arr(i) > arr(j) Then
' Swap the elements
temp = arr(i)
arr(i) = arr(j)
arr(j) = temp
End If
Next j
Next i
' Declare a variable to store the output string
Dim output As String
output = ""
' Loop through the array and concatenate the elements to the output string
For i = 1 To 10
output = output & arr(i) & " "
Next i
' Display the output string in a message box
MsgBox output

Excel Macros and VBA.Title: Use a UserForm
Excel Macros and VBA.Description: Use a UserForm to create a graphical user interface for your program.
Excel Macros and VBA.Instruction: Create a UserForm that allows the user to enter their name and age, and displays a greeting message based on their input.
Excel Macros and VBA.Code:
' Create a UserForm named UserForm1
' Add two labels, two text boxes, and a command button to the UserForm
' Set the properties of the controls as follows:
' Label1: Caption = "Name:"
' Label2: Caption = "Age:"
' TextBox1: Name = "txtName"
' TextBox2: Name = "txtAge"
' CommandButton1: Name = "cmdSubmit", Caption = "Submit"

' Write the code for the click event of the command button
Private Sub cmdSubmit_Click()
' Declare variables to store the name and age
Dim name As String
Dim age As Integer
' Get the values from the text boxes
name = txtName.Text
age = txtAge.Text
' Declare a variable to store the greeting message
Dim message As String
message = ""
' Check if the name and age are valid
If name = "" Then
' Display an error message if the name is empty
MsgBox "Please enter your name."
' Set the focus to the name text box
txtName.SetFocus
' Exit the subroutine
Exit Sub
End If
If age <= 0 Or Not IsNumeric(age) Then
' Display an error message if the age is invalid
MsgBox "Please enter a valid age."
' Set the focus to the age text box
txtAge.SetFocus
' Exit the subroutine
Exit Sub
End If
' Generate the greeting message based on the name and age
message = "Hello, " & name & "! "
If age < 18 Then
message = message & "You are a minor."
ElseIf age >= 18 And age < 65 Then
message = message & "You are an adult."
Else
message = message & "You are a senior."
End If
' Display the greeting message in a message box
MsgBox message
' Clear the text boxes
txtName.Text = ""
txtAge.Text = ""
' Set the focus to the name text box
txtName.SetFocus
End Sub
Excel Macros and VBA.Solution:
' Solution code
' Create a UserForm named UserForm1
' Add two labels, two text boxes, and a command button to the UserForm
' Set the properties of the controls as follows:
' Label1: Caption = "Name:"
' Label2: Caption = "Age:"
' TextBox1: Name = "txtName"
' TextBox2: Name = "txtAge"
' CommandButton1: Name = "cmdSubmit", Caption = "Submit"

' Write the code for the click event of the command button
Private Sub cmdSubmit_Click()
' Declare variables to store the name and age
Dim name As String
Dim age As Integer
' Get the values from the text boxes
name = txtName.Text
age = txtAge.Text
' Declare a variable to store the greeting message
Dim message As String
message = ""
' Check if the name and age are valid
If name = "" Then
' Display an error message if the name is empty
MsgBox "Please enter your name."
' Set the focus to the name text box
txtName.SetFocus
' Exit the subroutine
Exit Sub
End If
If age <= 0 Or Not IsNumeric(age) Then
' Display an error message if the age is invalid
MsgBox "Please enter a valid age."
' Set the focus to the age text box
txtAge.SetFocus
' Exit the subroutine
Exit Sub
End If
' Generate the greeting message based on the name and age
message = "Hello, " & name & "! "
If age < 18 Then
message = message & "You are a minor."
ElseIf age >= 18 And age < 65 Then
message = message & "You are an adult."
Else
message = message & "You are a senior."
End If
' Display the greeting message in a message box
MsgBox message
' Clear the text boxes
txtName.Text = ""
txtAge.Text = ""
' Set the focus to the name text box
txtName.SetFocus
End Sub
